channel.title: Developing on Android
channel.description: I don't currently have a laptop/computer, only my Android phone (Samsung Galaxy S3). I want to make a start developing a website and developing a server. Is any of this possible directly from my phone? I need pointing in the right direction.

item.title: Developing on Android
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

Maybe you should get a laptop slash computer and stop being a poor shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Developing on Android
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

There’s various IDE’s and such, as listed above that are Android apps. That along with HDMI out and a mini-usb keyboard/mouse combo and you could have something (Assuming that exists, not really sure).

However, I’m not sure if you have this or not but, if you have an old phone or tablet even, or could obtain one easily, you could install a very, very lightweight Linux distro on to it and work like that.

Also, just remembered as I was typing check out the Raspberry Pi. An affordable $35-$40 mini-computer, which would be ideal for your situation.

Read full topic

item.title: Developing on Android
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Found this today on HN: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.aide.web

Read full topic

item.title: Developing on Android
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

From 2012, but I’m sure you can search the play store or google for an apk.

http://android.appstorm.net/roundups/developer/15-apps-for-programming-on-android/

Doubt it’s gonna be easy though. due to the small screen, integrated keyboard, and development environment.

Read full topic

item.title: Developing on Android
item.dc:creator: @Bear_Grylls1 Bear_Grylls
item.description:
@Bear_Grylls1 wrote:

Ok thanks. I’ll just have to wait then.

Read full topic

item.title: Developing on Android
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

I believe you can sync to a monitor/tv and connect to a bluetooth keyboard. Don’t think you’ll have a good time installing any sort of interpreter (PHP, Ruby, Python) or the JVM though. You could probably make a basic HTML/CSS/JS website, though.

Read full topic
